alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Wyandot (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 3:47PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Wyandot and southeastern Hancock Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 347 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Arlington, or 10 miles south of Findlay, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Upper Sandusky, Forest, Arlington, Sycamore, Morral, Vanlue, Marseilles, Carey, Nevada, Mount Blanchard, Wharton, Harpster, Kirby and Williamstown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for north central and northwestern Ohio.
